name: squelch
content:
squelch verb
(SOUND)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ I usually + adv/prep ] to make a sucking sound like the one produced when you are walking on soft, wet ground: He got out of the car and squelched through the mud to open the gate.

squelch verb
(STOP)
[ T ] US to quickly end something that is causing you problems: A spokeswoman at the White House has squelched rumors about the president's ill health.
[ T ] US to silence someone by criticizing them: The senator thoroughly squelched the journalist who tried to interrupt him during his speech.

Interrupting & preventing from speaking
a sucking sound like the one produced when you are walking on soft, wet ground: As the hikers walked down the path by the house, she could hear the squelch of their boots in the mud.

Related word
squelchy
Add to word list
Add to word list
to stop something quickly and completely: One professor claimed that the university tried to squelch his criticisms.
